ygData.subject: Re: Practicing Wind with Mino Horn (Change to Caster Caution)
ygData.msgSnippet: Laluni, Be careful your magic users don t have pets/animations. Seems the little critters get VERY upset when their master disappears, and show you their
ygData.messageBody:
Laluni,

Be careful your magic users don't have pets/animations.
Seems the little critters get VERY upset when their master disappears, and
show you their displeasure by inflicting excessive damage on themselves
and dyeing, and the owners then get a tad upset too :>


Frashii, 21st Missed Note Bard
Tarew Marr, follower of Rodcet Nife
Seekers of Lore, http://www.loreseekers.com

Message: 4
Date: Fri, 03 Sep 1999 16:03:03 -0700
From: "Steven S. Klug" <sklug@...>
Subject: Re: Practicing Wind with Mino Horn

It definitely does. I use a minotaur horn all the time. I never really
had to spefically practice my wind skill. When I got invisibility, I
ended
up using it so much, that it goes up to max each level on its own.

A tip, if you're in a train prone zone, like Mistmoore for example, and
you're in a group that has mana dumpers. When the party is done being
healed up with Hymn, kick in group invisibility. It's saved my party and
my own life on numerous occasions. Of course, this only applies between
levels 19 and 31. (Not that I would know about the latter level...)

Laluni the 26th level bard on E'ci.
